etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of Mental Science. From cretin + -oid

definitions: An individual who resembles a person affected by cretinism; (also, specifically) an individual affected by cretinism who has relatively little brain damage, or an individual who has severe hypothyroidism beginning after infancy or childhood.
Resembling or characteristic of cretinism or of a person affected by this.
